title: Data Encryption at Rest and Transit
description:
Implement Comprehensive Data Encryption Strategy

Add end-to-end encryption to protect sensitive data both when stored in the database (at rest) and during transmission over the network (in transit).

Requirements:

Data at Rest (Database Encryption):
- Implement database-level encryption for all tables containing sensitive data
- Choose appropriate encryption algorithm (AES-256 recommended)
- Set up secure key management system for encryption keys
- Implement key rotation strategy with configurable intervals
- Ensure encrypted fields remain queryable where necessary (consider deterministic vs probabilistic encryption)
- Document which tables/columns are encrypted and why
- Handle encryption/decryption transparently in the application layer

Data in Transit (TLS 1.3):
- Configure web server to enforce TLS 1.3 as minimum protocol version
- Disable legacy protocols (TLS 1.0, 1.1, 1.2) and weak cipher suites
- Obtain and install valid SSL/TLS certificates from trusted CA
- Set up automatic certificate renewal process
- Configure HTTP to HTTPS redirects for all endpoints
- Implement HSTS (HTTP Strict Transport Security) headers
- Ensure all API endpoints and external service connections use TLS 1.3

Additional Considerations:
- Verify encryption doesn't significantly impact performance (benchmark before/after)
- Update backup and restore procedures to handle encrypted data
- Ensure compliance with relevant regulations (GDPR, HIPAA, etc.)
- Add monitoring/alerting for certificate expiration
- Document encryption implementation for security audits
- Test encryption/decryption functionality across different environments

Success Criteria:
- All sensitive data encrypted in database with no plaintext exposure
- All network traffic uses TLS 1.3 with strong cipher suites
- Security scan confirms no weak protocols or vulnerabilities
- Application performance remains within acceptable thresholds
